actor_awards.notes: Oakland was a highly respected character actor who appeared in over 130 film and television roles. While he famously delivered the closing exposition in Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psycho', he did not receive major individual competitive awards.

filmography.title: Psycho
filmography.role_description: The psychiatrist who delivers the famous, chilling final monologue explaining Norman Bates's fractured psyche and the nature of his 'Mother' personality.
filmography.plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

filmography.title: West Side Story
filmography.role_description: A hard-boiled, cynical, and bigoted police detective who harasses both the Jets and the Sharks, trying to drive them off his beat.
filmography.plot: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Picture (Film won 10 Oscars)

filmography.title: Bullitt
filmography.role_description: The tough but supportive police captain who backs his maverick detective, Frank Bullitt, against political pressure from an ambitious senator.
filmography.plot: An all-guts, no-glory San Francisco cop becomes determined to find the underworld kingpin who killed the witness in his protection.

filmography.title: The Sand Pebbles
filmography.role_description: A burly, antagonistic machinist's mate on the USS San Pablo who clashes with the protagonist Jake Holman before eventually earning his respect.
filmography.plot: An engineer on a U.S. Navy gunboat in 1926 China alienates his shipmates with his independent nature while trying to avoid the brewing civil war.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture, Best Actor (Steve McQueen)

filmography.title: I Want to Live!
filmography.role_description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist who initially sensationalizes Barbara Graham's case but later becomes convinced of her innocence and fights to save her.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of Barbara Graham, a woman with a criminal past who is convicted of murder and faces the gas chamber.

filmography.title: The Night Stalker
filmography.role_description: The irascible, shouting newspaper editor who constantly clashes with his reporter Carl Kolchak over his outlandish supernatural theories.
filmography.plot: An abrasive Las Vegas newspaper reporter investigates a series of murders that he believes are the work of a vampire.
filmography.awards: None (Highest rated TV movie at the time)

filmography.title: The Night Strangler
filmography.role_description: Oakland reprises his role as the skeptical editor, now in Seattle, who is once again tormented by Kolchak's discoveries of the paranormal.
filmography.plot: Reporter Carl Kolchak hunts a killer in the Seattle Underground who has been strangling women every 21 years for over a century.

filmography.title: Emperor of the North
filmography.role_description: A rail yard cop who chases the hobos and is humiliated by Lee Marvin's character in a memorable confrontation.
filmography.plot: In the 1930s Pacific Northwest, a legendary hobo and a sadistic railway conductor engage in a duel of wits and violence aboard a freight train.

filmography.title: Chato's Land
filmography.role_description: A loud, aggressive member of a posse hunting a half-Apache man, whose brutality contributes to the group's undoing.
filmography.plot: After killing a sheriff in self-defense, a half-Apache man is hunted by a posse of white men through the harsh desert terrain.

filmography.title: On a Clear Day You Can See Forever
filmography.role_description: A colleague of the protagonist psychiatrist who becomes involved in the case of a woman who recalls her past lives under hypnosis.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist falls in love with the 19th-century personality of a woman he is treating for smoking addiction through hypnosis.

filmography.title: Follow That Dream
filmography.role_description: A gangster who tries to intimidate the naive Kwimper family when they homestead on a Florida beach near his gambling operation.
filmography.plot: A vagabond family claims squatter's rights on a strip of Florida highway and refuses to leave, despite the efforts of government officials and gangsters.

filmography.title: Murder, Inc.
filmography.role_description: A dedicated police detective working to bring down the notorious organized crime syndicate responsible for hundreds of contract killings.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of the Brooklyn crime syndicate known as Murder, Inc., focusing on the hitman Abe Reles.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Peter Falk)

filmography.title: The Brothers Karamazov
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this adaptation of Dostoevsky's novel about four brothers and their complex relationship with their father.
filmography.plot: The four sons of a boorish patriarch are suspects when he is murdered, each having a motive for the crime.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Lee J. Cobb)

filmography.title: Tony Rome
filmography.role_description: A wealthy construction tycoon who hires private investigator Tony Rome to find out why his daughter is acting strangely.
filmography.plot: A Miami private investigator is hired by a millionaire to find a missing diamond pin, leading him into a web of blackmail and murder.

filmography.title: The Hunting Party
filmography.role_description: A rugged member of a wealthy man's hunting party who becomes embroiled in a violent pursuit of outlaws.
filmography.plot: A ruthless cattle baron tracks down the gang that kidnapped his wife, using long-range rifles to hunt them for sport.

filmography.title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
filmography.role_description: A police lieutenant determined to catch the ruthless Prohibition-era gangster Jack 'Legs' Diamond.
filmography.plot: A small-time crook rises to become a powerful mob boss in the 1920s, making enemies of both the police and rival syndicates.

filmography.title: Who Was That Lady?
filmography.role_description: A Soviet spy who becomes involved in a chemistry professor's bumbling attempt to trick his wife into believing he is an FBI agent.
filmography.plot: A chemistry professor tries to win back his wife by pretending to be an FBI agent, but the ruse attracts the attention of real foreign spies.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor (Dean Martin), Best Motion Picture – Comedy

filmography.title: The Satan Bug
filmography.role_description: A security agent involved in the desperate search for stolen flasks containing a deadly virus that could wipe out humanity.
filmography.plot: A former intelligence agent is brought back to investigate the theft of a lethal virus from a top-secret government lab.

filmography.title: The Plainsman
filmography.role_description: The Cheyenne chief who tries to maintain peace but is caught between his warring tribe members and the U.S. Cavalry.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok, Buffalo Bill Cody, and Calamity Jane team up to stop a Cheyenne uprising fueled by gunrunners.

filmography.title: Chubasco
filmography.role_description: A character in this drama about a rebellious young man who finds work and redemption on a tuna fishing boat.
filmography.plot: A young man in trouble with the law runs away to work on a tuna clipper and falls in love with the captain's daughter.

filmography.title: Scandalous John
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the story of an old rancher who believes he is living in the Wild West days, fighting to save his land.
filmography.plot: An aging rancher, living in a fantasy world of the Old West, goes on a cattle drive with his one remaining cow.

filmography.title: The Raiders
filmography.role_description: A cavalry sergeant who interacts with Wild Bill Hickok, Calamity Jane, and Buffalo Bill in this western adventure.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok, Buffalo Bill, and Calamity Jane join forces to stop a land-grabbing scheme in post-Civil War Texas.

filmography.title: Wall of Noise
filmography.role_description: A character in this drama set in the world of horse racing, dealing with the high stakes and personal conflicts of the track.
filmography.plot: A horse trainer gets involved with a wealthy stable owner's wife and a high-stakes racehorse.

filmography.title: Happy Mother's Day, Love George
filmography.role_description: The local sheriff investigating a series of disappearances and murders in a small coastal town.
filmography.plot: A young man searching for his birth parents arrives in a small fishing village, triggering a series of mysterious murders.

filmography.title: Hemingway's Adventures of a Young Man
filmography.role_description: A supporting character encountered by the protagonist Nick Adams during his travels and experiences based on Hemingway's stories.
filmography.plot: A young man leaves home to travel the country and the world, seeking experience and adventure to become a writer.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Drama
